DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Columnar Mucosa Goblet Cell Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not goblet cells were present in esophageal columnar mucosa.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Esophageal Columnar Mucosa Goblet Cell Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the esophagus._An epithelial cell that is taller than it is wide. The nucleus is oval, usually situated at the base of the cell. These cells line large glands and ducts._The moist tissue that lines some organs and body cavities (such as the nose, mouth, lungs) and makes mucus (a thick, slippery fluid)._Cells of the epithelial lining that produce and secrete mucins. (MeSH)_Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the esophagus.:An epithelial cell that is taller than it is wide. The nucleus is oval, usually situated at the base of the cell. These cells line large glands and ducts.:The moist tissue that lines some organs and body cavities (such as the nose, mouth, lungs) and makes mucus (a thick, slippery fluid).

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the esophagus.
An epithelial cell that is taller than it is wide. The nucleus is oval, usually situated at the base of the cell. These cells line large glands and ducts.

Property.preferredDefinition: Cells of the epithelial lining that produce and secrete mucins. (MeSH):Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A mucin-producing and -secreting epithelial cell found mainly in the intestinal and respiratory tracts.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
